> <OLD>
>
> As Rodimus located Wheelie, he would find the small bot over in the anterior
> bridge of the Ark.  Not where the main battle had been of the boarding
> action so long ago, but over within one of the secondary barracks units.
>
> As Rodimus came in, he would see Wheelie staring up silently over at a small
> plaque, upon which showed Cybertron, and in the Autobot language of the
> era...  <Remembrance>
>
> As Rodimus came on in, Wheelie quietly said, "I guess we know what we have
> to do.  We fight for them, and for you.  We fight for what will come to be,
> but for the past we cannot see."
>
> Glancing oer at the bridge, where the bodies of those who would fight...
> And those who would die, when things came to pass, "Is there any way to let
> them know?  When thier time will come to go?  The future is at stake..  But
> have we not yet changed enough to remake?  To let them know when their time
> is due..  So they can make amends for you?  To perhaps change what will
> come..  Have we not already done so much to overcome?  To those who will
> never get a cahnce to say goodbye..  Do we not owe it to them to give a try?
>  But things have already been done enough.  We can't throw it off the cuff."

<NEW>

A look of saddness passes through RODIMUS' optics as he watches
WHEELIE and then the other larger Autobots and Decepticons who lay
strewn all about. He looked very small as compared to his much larger
brethren who lay 'dead' on the floor, since he, like everyone else
here was nearly the size of a human in his robot mode.

"I wish we could give them some note, some piece of knowledge that
would help them make choices and perhaps even make a difference."

RODIMUS came and stood next to WHEELIE. "I can't pretend to know all
the ins and outs of all the temporal stuff." he said, his voice one of
a soldier rather than a technician or theoritician.

"If you want all the answers as to what and why, Legacy would
probrably have all the answers." RODIMUS said thoughtfully as he gazed
about again. "But I do believe that that mech came from a future where
things were changed and the destruction that followed. He was their
last ditch effort to fix it."

RODIMUS shook his head as he looked back at WHEELIE, "I don't want to
face a future like that." He clapped WHEELIE on the shoulder in a
friendly gesture, "But if you could, what kind of message would you
send them?"

(TAG)

Preston
